page.title: 11Changes in a village.
page.content: Sutton on Derwent remains as in the past a small rural community.In the past nearly everyone in the village was connected with the land.Today only a small numbers of people are still directly so involved.Most people nowadays work in other locations and travel out of the village daily. Forty years ago the village was a more self-contained unit than today. People were less reliant upon outside agencies than at present.For example,most households baked their own bread, grew much of their own produce and many had at least a pig and some hens.Today the necessities of life are obtained in the same way as in towns-from shops. Children in the past entertained themselves more than today and did not havethe many outside influences available today.
